His answer is that Abraham's saith proved itself by action, when he offered Isaac on the altar : if he had not acted thus, he would not have been accounted righteous, or called the Friend of God. It is interesting to observe how St. Paul deals with this statement, to which he distinctly refers in Rom. iv. 2.
